text: Alsodeiopsis schumannii is a species of plant in the Icacinaceae family. It is endemic to Tanzania, specifically the East Usambara, the Uluguru Mountains, and the Southern Highlands. It is an evergreen shrub or tree up to tall. The fruit, an oblong drupe ripening to orange-red, is edible with sweet and juicy pulp around the hard stone. ==References== * Lovett, J. & Clarke, G.P. 1998. Alsodeiopsis schumannii. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 20 August 2007. title: Alsodeiopsis schumannii
